meanings.definition: An imaginary evil spirit or goblin used to frighten children.
meanings.sent1: The bogeyman in the story scared the little kids at bedtime.
meanings.sent2: The children whispered about the bogeyman hiding in the closet.
meanings.sent3: The playful siblings pretended the bogeyman was lurking under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The idea of failure was the bogeyman haunting his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The dark shadow in the corner seemed to take the form of the bogeyman.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is widely regarded as an object of fear or avoidance.
meanings.sent1: The strict teacher was seen as the bogeyman by the students.
meanings.sent2: The old house on the hill was the neighborhood's bogeyman.
meanings.sent3: The dentist's drill became the bogeyman for the anxious patient.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline was the bogeyman that kept him up at night.
meanings.sent5: The uncertainty of the future was the bogeyman they all tried to ignore.
